intro: Halopeplis songarica, commonly known as the Songarica halopeplis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Halopeplis songarica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
